author: Shalini Ramachandran
title: What Is and Isn’t Available on ESPN’s New Streaming Service
text:
ESPN is launching a new streaming service that will test the sports juggernaut’s ability to appeal to customers who don’t want to pay for cable without losing the business of those who do.

The $4.99-a-month service, called ESPN+, offers an array of live sports, including some college games, pro golf and Grand Slam tennis, along with more niche offerings like boxing, cricket and rugby. The service will also showcase one Major League Baseball and one National Hockey League game a day during both sports’ regular seasons, as well... RELATED VIDEO A Brief History of Cable: Creating and Cutting the Cord The cable industry is undergoing a major transformation, as more Americans cut the cord on their cable subscriptions and flock to streaming services like Hulu and Netflix. So how did we get here? Illustration: Shaumbe Wright/WSJ
